artist: Gene Davis; Publisher: Petersburg Press, London and New York
image_copyright: © Estate of Gene Davis / Miles McEnery Gallery
inscription:
Numbered in black ink, verso

Title stamped in purple verso: series 2 / 6 sweet carburator
markings: Publisher's stamp, in purple, verso: petersburg press
medium: Color screenprint on canvas lamnated to board
provenance: (Dayton’s Gallery 12, Minneapolis, G06945; F6297, sold to Dayton); Bruce B. Dayton, Wayzata, Minn. (inv. no. 70-8); Estate of Bruce B. Dayton; bequeathed to MIA, 2016
signed: Singed in black ink, verso: Gene Davis
text: Color field painter Gene Davis began to employ vertical stripes of color in 1958 and continued throughout his career. He produced composition in all scales from his 43, 680 square-foot Niagara (said to be the world’s largest painting) to his 3/4 square-inch “micro-paintings.” Prints such as this used a canvas support, thereby creating an affordable, domestically-scaled version of Davis’s work.
title: Sweet Carburetor
